[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/token_deposit.rs] [Function: try_from_bytes()] [Panic Handling] Can malformed or truncated BCS bytes trigger panics during deserialization that are not properly caught, allowing attackers to crash validator nodes by emitting invalid TokenDeposit events? [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/token_deposit.rs] [Function: new()] [Account Validation] Does new() verify that the account parameter is not a system reserved address (0x0, 0x1, etc.), allowing attackers to emit deposit events to privileged addresses and potentially bypass access controls? [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/token_deposit.rs] [Function: new()] [TokenId Validation] Does new() validate the TokenId parameter to ensure the property_version is not u64::MAX, which could cause overflow when incrementing versions in token transfer operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/token_deposit.rs] [Function: amount()] [Integer Overflow] When the returned amount is used in arithmetic operations (e.g., adding to existing balances), can integer overflow occur if the total exceeds u64::MAX, silently wrapping to a small value and allowing unlimited token minting? [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/token_deposit.rs] [Function: amount()] [Zero Amount] Can amount() return 0 for valid deposit events, and if so, can this be exploited to create deposit records without actually transferring tokens, breaking accounting invariants? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/token_deposit.rs] [Function: account()] [Address Spoofing] Can the returned AccountAddress be a maliciously crafted address that matches a system account through hash collision, allowing unauthorized deposits to privileged accounts? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/token_deposit.rs] [Function: account()] [Null Address] Does account() properly handle the zero address (0x0), or can deposits to the null address cause token burns that break conservation of token supply? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/token_deposit.rs] [Function: account()] [Reference Lifetime] Can the returned reference to AccountAddress outlive the TokenDeposit struct in unsafe contexts, leading to use-after-free vulnerabilities in event processing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/token_deposit.rs] [Function: id()] [TokenId Collision] Can two different tokens share the same TokenId (same token_data_id and property_version), causing deposit events to be conflated and tokens to be credited to wrong recipients? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/token_deposit.rs] [Struct: TokenId] [Clone Safety] Does the Clone implementation for TokenId perform deep cloning of the nested token_data_id, or can shallow cloning lead to shared mutable state and race conditions in concurrent event processing?
